TopicTitle: The "You know you're playing a lot of KSP when..." thread

Articles.Content: When you start to make a list of what mods reality has installed.
When you begin to consider doing a mission in real time, without any warp, just for the heck of it.
when you catch yourself scribbling rocket designs while on the bus to/from work (or worse, at work).

When you begin to consider doing a mission in real time, without any warp, just for the heck of it.

I once launched a ship to the Mun on my laptop. After the ejection burn I got distracted and... just closed the laptop without even hitting pause... When I opened it in the morning, the ship had already crashed into the Mun
When you start a long long download. Then immediately hold alt and start smashing period ...

When you dream of ship design's, whether spaceplane or rocket, on a nightly basis.

I still do even though I haven't played in months.
When you start comparing locomotives from openttd to figure out which is the most effecient. or when you try (and fail) to create a Kerbal in Spore.
When you're playing Minecraft, waiting for your iron to smelt, and you think: "why don't I just timewarp?"
When you look up in the sky, you see the Moon and on its side a bright star, you think "Hey, that's Minmus right there!... Oh wait..."

You know you play too much KSP when your friends yell at you something like "I said lunch, not launch"...

You know your girlfriend plays too much KSP, when you come home late from a party and yellow sticker on the fridge says "I ate all the snacks..."

when you try (and fail) to create a Kerbal in Spore.

I did that!

Yeah, it didn't turn out great, but it wasn't bad... Much.

You know you play too much KSP when your friends yell at you something like "I said lunch, not launch"...

You know your girlfriend plays too much KSP, when you come home late from a party and yellow sticker on the fridge says "I ate all the snacks..."

Must be awesome to have a gf who likes KSP!

Actually, must be awesome to have a gf...
You know you play to much when you see the day mechjeb lands you here...sucessfully...
When you look at Eve...Er I mean Venus in the night sky, and see a tiny, faint star close by, and insist you've just seen gilly.

When you hear

and think: KETHANE SCANNER. And you know you're on the forum too much when you actually remember this thread in the car and know you should post this....

Anyone els thought this about Lorde?
When you've read every single post on this thread............
You start making cinematics

You know you play too much KSP...

...when you get fracking blisters on your gorramn fingertips!
When I see my post in this thread, on page 2, about one year ago... Maybe I'm not playing too mutch, but too long, that is for sure

1. When you struggle to remember that the Earth has only one moon.

2. When you try to timewarp when something's in the microwave.
You know that you play KSP too much when you start drawing kerbal comic in your exams:

1. When you struggle to remember that the Earth has only one moon.

2. When you try to timewarp when something's in the microwave.

....lol.....

When you Kerbalize Real life rockets:)

Both of these are gonna hit 2K feet with cams as payload at NXRS in Bend Oregon tomorrow!.

Ad Astra Combustus !
You know you play too much ksp when you leave a permanent bum mark on your chair...
You know you play too much KSP when you start wondering if you have enough delta-V to get to school on time.
